meanings.definition: Containing nothing; not filled or occupied.
meanings.sent1: The room felt the emptiest it had ever been after all the furniture was removed.
meanings.sent2: The box was the emptiest when it was completely void of any items.
meanings.sent3: The party was the emptiest when the clown forgot to show up.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt the emptiest when she realized she had lost her most precious possession.
meanings.sent5: The forest was the emptiest during the winter when all the leaves had fallen.

meanings.sent1: The apology seemed the emptiest when it lacked sincerity.
meanings.sent2: His promises felt the emptiest when they were never fulfilled.
meanings.sent3: The excuse was the emptiest when it was filled with obvious lies.
meanings.sent4: The song felt the emptiest when the lyrics held no emotional depth.
meanings.sent5: The painting appeared the emptiest when it failed to evoke any emotions in the viewers.

meanings.sent1: The task felt the emptiest when it held no value or purpose.
meanings.sent2: The meeting room was the emptiest when no decisions were made.
meanings.sent3: His words sounded the emptiest when they were devoid of truth.
meanings.sent4: The trophy case seemed the emptiest when it contained only participation ribbons.
meanings.sent5: The gesture felt the emptiest when it was insincere and forced.
